comments:
This should allow us to tag tests for which we know they are slower 
because of new functionality can be rendered in say gray rather then red.

I added new API to the BarGraph to annoted results (and have negative results painted in grey instead of 
red). Need to figure out how to show the annotation and how to store it in the DB.

Sonia, how hard is it to implement a hover on the performance fingerprint graph so that the annotation 
is shown when hovering over the result?

The only challenge here is to find a way to create the hover without having 
the text truncated (bug 89805).  I use "alt" and "title" to create the hovers 
for the line graphs, but these attributes are not sufficient for the job.

I got asked in the PMC call this morning, why we haven't implemented this.

Andre, the anotation can be done with a hover, as you suggested. You probably want to have the text 
that is returned be something like:
    This performance comparison is no longer valid. Reason:
    ...

Are you still hung up trying to figure out how to store the data in the database? If so, who do you need 
to talk to to get that solved?

Basically, I'll have to talk to myself :-)
Will do tonight...
I hope to have this fixed today.

I've added support for "summary comments" to the performance plugin.
The basic idea is to set a comment on the PerformanceMeter
in a similar way as the tagging for performance summary is done:

PerformanceMeter pm= ...
Performance.getDefault().setComment(pm, EXPLAINS_DEGRADATION_COMMENT, "a comment...")

At the other end both the comment kind and the comment text is available as instance variables of the 
SummaryEntry.

Sonia, could you please feed this in the BarGraph API.

I ran a lot of test on a local database, but since I don't have access to the Ottawa DB, I'm not sure 
whether the DB upgrade code will work. So please report all suspicious messages immediately.

I'll add a setComment call to the Compare performance test so that you can verify that a comment 
comes through...

The excpetions your are seeing aren't related to the "slow down explained" feature, because I've 
checked in the code one hour ago. So the nightly build ran a version of the performance plugin that 
hadn't changed for weeks.

I've released changes to show bar graphs/x's in grey for scenarios with 
annotations.  I still do not have support to show the comment in a hover on an 
image map, so I have placed the comments at the top of the details scenario 
results page for now.  Still need to verify, not sure if anyone is using 
annotations right now.

We need to be able to annotate any performance tests, not only summary tests. Is
there any technical limitation to making it that way?

For instance, I would expect that on the table that shows detailed information
about the test results (scenarios vs configurations), the hover tip for failures
would show the degradation explanation instead of the standard message:
"Performance criteria not met when compared to...".

Created an attachment (id=21216)
screenshot

Sonia we have a situation because of platform differences in SWT where we are
way faster on windows and slightly slower on Linux so we are going to make an
explanation.

We would like it so that a succeeding test is always green and a failure with
explanation is grey. Is this possible?
This is the way it works currently : )

As an aside (and not a comment about this particular case), I think it's bogus in general to flag a test as 
gray if we fail it and green if we pass _by_default_. We should treat grayed tests as meaning "something 
happened which invalidates this test", not "if it's slower, it's not our fault".

We should also not force it to be a fingerprint test - a grey X in the results
would be better.

Is this going to happen for 3.1? We need to know what to do with our tests for
Friday. We don't want to ship with red X's. (grey is fine)

Sonia and I have implemented the "slow down explained" tag for fingerprints only (since that was the 
original request).
To add them to all tests (as asked for in comment #15) is more involved and won't happen for 3.1.

What is the recommended action for non-fingerprint tests which are known to be
slower? Do we ship with red X's for 3.1?

If we shipped nothing red, then people would assume we were cheating. If you feel the test is no longer 
showing useful information, then definitely remove it. Otherwise, I'd just leave it.
has been implemented some time ago...
